purpleculture_pinyin:
xiāng
to inlay; to embed; ridge; border
инкрустировать; вставлять; гребень; граница
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 镶)
Pictophonetic: 襄 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
鑲嵌 [ xiāng qiàn ]: to inlay; to embed; to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring); tiling; tesselation
鑲金 [ xiāng jīn ]: gilded; inlaid with gold
鑲牙 [ xiāng yá ]: to have a false tooth set in; denture
鑲黃旗 [ xiāng huáng qí ]: Bordered Yellow banner or Hövööt Shar khoshuu in Xilin Gol league 锡林郭勒盟 , Inner Mongolia
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 襄 [ xiāng ] to aid, to help, to assist; to undress
Ru_trainchinese: xiāng: (глаг) оправлять, обрамлять; кромка, оправа
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: I inlayed (decorate the surface of something) my metal pigeon coop to make it a bit more attractive for when I invite friends over.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " gold " to " xiang " sound. The original meaning is the blank tire and flesh in the caster model. "Shuowen": "Inlaying, making the shape. From the gold, the sound." Xu Kai "Xizhuan": "The cast of the bell and the genus, the hollow inside, is used as a soil model in the model, so later But it also flows out of copper. It is like the fruit of the jade." This usage is not seen in ancient books.

" Inlay " is also the name of an ancient weapon. "Release name. "Shi Bing": "Hook inlay, the two ends are called hooks, and the center is called inlays. Either push inlays, or hook guides, which are suitable for use." Such as "Jijiu Pian" "Spear, Shield, Blade and Knife Hook", Yan Shigu Note: "Inlays are also knives and the like, but their blades are profitable, so it is harmful to others." Zhang Hua of the Western Jin Dynasty "Boling Palace Xiaqu": "Lumbar halberd, holding a white head ."

"Inlay" usually means to embed something into another object, namely inlay. For example, Chapter 8 of "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms": "It is a jade seal with a radius of four inches, with five dragons on top, and a corner missing. It is inlaid with gold." Chapter 40 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "It was Sister Feng. We negotiated with Mandarin Duck, and only took a pair of old four-flute ivory gold-inlaid chopsticks with Grandma Liu."
humanum_short_description_en: From " gold " to " xiang " sound. The original meaning is the blank tire and flesh in the caster model.
humanum_full_description:
從「金」，「襄」聲。本義是鑄器模型裡的坯胎、瓤子。《說文》：「鑲，作型中膓也。从金，襄聲。」徐鍇《繫傳》：「鑄鐘鏞屬，使內空者，於型範中更作土模，所以後卻流銅也。又若果實之穰。」古書中未見此用法。

　　「鑲」也是古兵器名。《釋名．釋兵》：「鉤鑲，兩頭曰鉤，中央曰鑲。或推鑲，或鉤引，用之之宜也。」如〈急就篇〉「矛鋋鑲盾刃刀鉤」，顏師古注：「鑲者，亦刀劒之類，其刃卻偃而外利，所以推攘而害人也。」西晉張華〈博陵王宮俠曲〉：「腰間叉素戟，手持白頭鑲。」

　　「鑲」後多表示把東西嵌入另一物體，即鑲嵌。如《三國演義》第8回：「啟視之，乃一玉璽，方圓四寸，上鑴五龍交紐，傍缺一角，以黃金鑲之。」《紅樓夢》第40回：「原是鳳姐和鴛鴦商議定了，單拿一雙老年四楞象牙鑲金的筷子與劉姥姥。」
humanum_short_description: 從「金」，「襄」聲。本義是鑄器模型裡的坯胎、瓤子。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
鑲 (Simplified: 镶)
Pinyin: xiāng
English Definition: to inlay; to embed; ridge; border
Total strokes: 25; Radical: 金
Pictophonetic: 襄 indicates the sound; 釒 (metal) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 襄 [ xiāng ] to aid, to help, to assist; to undress
Example Words:
鑲嵌 [ xiāng qiàn ]: to inlay; to embed; to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring); tiling; tesselation
鑲金 [ xiāng jīn ]: gilded; inlaid with gold
鑲牙 [ xiāng yá ]: to have a false tooth set in; denture
鑲黃旗 [ xiāng huáng qí ]: Bordered Yellow banner or Hövööt Shar khoshuu in Xilin Gol league 锡林郭勒盟 , Inner Mongolia

從「 金 」，「 襄 」聲。本義是鑄器模型裡的坯胎、瓤子。《說文》：「鑲，作型中膓也。从金，襄聲。」徐鍇《繫傳》：「鑄鐘鏞屬，使內空者，於型範中更作土模，所以後卻流銅也。又若果實之穰。」古書中未見此用法。 「 鑲 」也是古兵器名。《釋名．釋兵》：「鉤鑲，兩頭曰鉤，中央曰鑲。或推鑲，或鉤引，用之之宜也。」如〈急就篇〉「矛鋋鑲盾刃刀鉤」，顏師古注：「鑲者，亦刀劒之類，其刃卻偃而外利，所以推攘而害人也。」西晉張華〈博陵王宮俠曲〉：「腰間叉素戟，手持白頭鑲。」 「 鑲 」後多表示把東西嵌入另一物體，即鑲嵌。如《三國演義》第8回：「啟視之，乃一玉璽，方圓四寸，上鑴五龍交紐，傍缺一角，以黃金鑲之。」《紅樓夢》第40回：「原是鳳姐和鴛鴦商議定了，單拿一雙老年四楞象牙鑲金的筷子與劉姥姥。」

Xu Kai "Xizhuan": "The cast of the bell and the genus, the hollow inside, is used as a soil model in the model, so later But it also flows out of copper. It is like the fruit of the jade." This usage is not seen in ancient books. " Inlay" is also the name of an ancient weapon. "Release name. "Shi Bing": "Hook inlay, the two ends are called hooks, and the center is called inlays. Either push inlays, or hook guides, which are suitable for use." Such as "Jijiu Pian" "Spear, Shield, Blade and Knife Hook", Yan Shigu Note: "Inlays are also knives and the like, but their blades are profitable, so it is harmful to others." Zhang Hua of the Western Jin Dynasty "Boling Palace Xiaqu": "Lumbar halberd, holding a white head ." "Inlay" usually means to embed something into another object, namely inlay. For example, Chapter 8 of "The Romance of the Three Kingdoms": "It is a jade seal with a radius of four inches, with five dragons on top, and a corner missing. It is inlaid with gold." Chapter 40 of "Dream of Red Mansions": "It was Sister Feng. We negotiated with Mandarin Duck, and only took a pair of old four-flute ivory gold-inlaid chopsticks with Grandma Liu."

鑲字的基本解释

鑲
xiāng
见“镶”。

鑲字的汉语字典释义

[①]［xiāng］
［《廣韻》息良切，平陽，心。］
［《廣韻》汝陽切，平陽，日。］
［《廣韻》女良切，平陽，娘。］
“镶1”的繁体字。
(1)古兵器名。
(2)一物体围在另一物体的边缘或嵌入另一物体内。

鑲字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鑲； 康熙笔画：25； 页码：页1327第01
【唐韻】汝羊切【集韻】汝陽切，?音穰。【說文】作型。中腸也。【正字通】或曰型者，鑄器之法。凡作型，先以繩爲坯胎，型固，則從竅㨨繩緒耑，繩窮而型存，有類於腸也。　又【廣韻】鉤鑲，兵器。【釋名】鉤鑲，兩頭曰鉤，中央曰鑲。或椎鑲，或鉤引，用之之宜也。　又【廣韻】息良切【集韻】思將切，?音襄。又【廣韻】女良切【集韻】尼良切，?音孃。義?同。

鑲字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鑲字的起名意思

暂无。

["Guangyun" Xiliangqie, Pingyang, Heart. ]

Traditional Chinese characters for "Inlaid 1".
(1) Names of ancient weapons.
(2) An object surrounds the edge of another object or is embedded in another object.
set
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 inlay; Kangxi strokes: 25; Page number: page 1327 No. 01
[Tang Yun] Ruyang cut [Jiyun] Ruyang cut,? Yin Rang. [Said the text] Make a style. The midgut also. 【Zhengzitong】or said type, the method of casting. When making a shape, first use the rope as the blank tire, and the shape is solid, and then the rope is threaded from the orifice. The rope is poor and the shape is stored, which is similar to the intestine.　[Guangyun] hook inlay, weapon. 【Release name】Hook inlay, with hooks at the two ends and inlay at the center. Or vertebra inlay, or hook lead, it is appropriate to use.　[Guangyun] Xiliangqie [Jiyun] Thinking will cut,? Yinxiang. And [Guang Yun] Female Liang Cut [Ji Yun] Ni Liang cut,? Yin Niang. Righteous? Same.
